arm_group.description: Patients with tonic-clonis seizures are observed in a video/EEG room. In the case of seizures, the treatment mask or dummy mask are administered, according to a randomized cross-over study design.
Patients with generalized epileptic paroxysms are observed by EEG during baseline, treatment mask and dummy mask use, according to a randomized cross-over study design.

brief_summary.textblock:
By enabling a partial rebreathing of expired gas, a moderate respiratory acidosis is
      induced, without causing hypoxia in the patient.

      Based on the scientific literature on the subject, the study hypothesis is that the fall in
      body pH will be able to stop and/or prevent epileptic brain activity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stopping and Preventing Epileptic Seizures Using a Partial Rebreathing Mask

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Epilepsy

          -  18-80 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

intervention.description: The CDA (Carbon Dioxide Accumulation) mask effectuates an increase in the inspired CO2 fraction, while allowing an adequate supply of fresh air to the patient.
The dummy mask is similar in appearance to the treatment mask, but causes only a negligible change in blood gases

clinical_study.official_title: Stopping and Preventing Epileptic Seizures Using a Partial Rebreathing Mask

authority: Denmark: Danish Health and Medicines Authority

primary_outcome.description: Length of epileptic seizure with treatment mask vs. dummy mask
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of mask treatment during acute seizures: approx. 3 minutes from start of mask treatment until end of seizure

primary_outcome.description: Frequency of epileptic paroxysms as measured by EEG, treatment mask vs. dummy mask
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of mask treatment: 45 minutes during which patient is monitored with EEG

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Measures oxygen saturation using a pulse oximeter during mask treatment

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
